intro: Aporum merrillii, commonly known as the Philippine fern, is a species of tree fern native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Cyatheaceae and is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and large, pinnate fronds. The plant has a slow growth rate and can reach heights of up to 10 meters in optimal conditions. Its fronds are often used in traditional medicine and horticulture. Aporum merrillii plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, contributing to biodiversity and soil stability.
